Key Arguments: There is mainstream distrust of current media due to bias and censorship.
Censorship, such as that seen around COVID-19 vaccinations, has eroded trust.
Further censorship will lead to more erosion of trust.
The legislation's exclusion of certain bodies from misinformation definitions is concerning.
There is a need for opposing information to make informed decisions.
The legislation should include viewpoints from professionals and researchers that counter mainstream views.
The identification of harm is subjective and varies between groups.
Notable Quotes: Finding ways to further censor information will lead to further erosion in trust.
What would be the punishment handed out to these excluded bodies if they have been found to have censored information that turned out to be correct or true in nature?
In science we would not get anywhere if discourse contrary to what is known is not allowed.
